thread.title: Bun B says 'we're all one' in Houston, unveils cap collection
thread.title_full: Bun B says 'we're all one' in Houston, unveils cap collection - Houston Chronicle

author: chron.com
title: Bun B says 'we're all one' in Houston, unveils cap collection
text:
Rapper Bun B, dubbed by many the unofficial mayor of Houston, hopes the city leaves a lasting impression on visitors here for Super Bowl LI festivities.
"Houston is literally the most diverse city in America. There's over 100 different languages spoken in the city of Houston. It doesn't matter who you are and where you're from. There's someone here just like you," he says.
Bun B and Pimp C, of course, took their Port Arthur sound far beyond the state as seminal rap group UGK.
Photo: Courtesy Image 1 of / 8 8 Bun B's New Era Cap collection, unveiled during Super Bowl week in Houston. Bun B's New Era Cap collection, unveiled during Super Bowl week in Houston. Photo: Courtesy Image 8 of 8 Bun B says 'we're all one' in Houston, unveils cap collection 1 / 8 Back to Gallery "We welcome everybody with open arms. I know there's a lot of divisiveness in this country right now. It doesn't matter what side of the issues you stand on. In Houston, we're all one," he says.
"This is a culture that embraces people, not only that look like you but those that don't look like you."
SUPER BOWL LIVE: Houston's Lyric Michelle makes a big, brief impression
Bun B mingled with fans Thursday at the Galleria to unveil his New Era cap collection at the Lids store. It includes three colorful designs inspired by the Houston Astros, Rockets and Texans. Each cap retails for $34.99 and features the rapper's "Trill OG" logo.
He worked closely with designers to "put our own little twist on it" and has previously collaborated with the brand on caps.
The unveiling was just of many stops on his Super Bowl week goodwill tour.
"It's been nonstop. I haven't gotten much rest. But I don't wanna have rest. I wanna make sure that I'm everywhere I need to be to represent the city to the fullest of my capabilities," he said.
"I'm gonna be tired at the end of this week. But I'm happy to be an ambassador of the city of Houston."
